intro: Dysophylla myosuroides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like structures that are actually modified leaves, known as phyllodes, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of blue or violet, which are typically arranged in clusters. It is native to Australia and thrives in coastal and sandy environments. Dysophylla myosuroides is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
